DataTypesALaCart-0.1.0.0: Implementation and extensions of article Data Types A La Cart

Copyright(c) Martin Frešer & Borja Bovcon, 2014
Licenseunlicensed
Maintainermartin.freser@gmail.com, bb1359@student.uni-lj.si
Stabilityexperimental
Safe HaskellNone
LanguageHaskell2010

Expr

Contents

  • Data types
  • Classes
  • Basic operators
  • various functions
  • various examples

Description

This is an implementation of expressions described in a scientific paper titled Data types `a la carte.

Synopsis

  • data Expr f = In (f (Expr f))
  • data Val a = Val Int
  • data Add e = Add e e
  • data Mul x = Mul x x
  • data Div x = Div x x
  • data Mod x = Mod x x
  • data (f :+: g) e
    • = Inl (f e)
    • | Inr (g e)
  • class (Functor sub, Functor sup) => sub :<: sup where
    • inj :: sub a -> sup a
  • class Render f where
    • render :: Render g => f (Expr g) -> String
  • class Functor f => Eval f where
    • evalAlgebra :: f Int -> Int
  • val :: Val :<: f => Int -> Expr f
  • (.+) :: Add :<: f => Expr f -> Expr f -> Expr f
  • eval :: Eval f => Expr f -> Int
  • compose :: [a -> a] -> a -> a
  • pretty :: Render f => Expr f -> String
  • foldExpr :: Functor f => (f a -> a) -> Expr f -> a
  • addExample :: Expr (Val :+: Add)
  • rezSestevanje :: Expr ((:+:) Add Val)
  • rezMnozenje :: Expr ((:+:) Val Mul)
  • rezDeljenje :: Expr ((:+:) Val Div)
  • rezModul :: Expr ((:+:) Val Mod)
  • rezSestevanjeMnozenje :: Expr ((:+:) Val ((:+:) Add Mul))

data (f :+: g) e infixr 7

Coproduct of two signatures

Constructors

Inl (f e) 
Inr (g e) 

Instances

(Functor f, Functor g, Functor h, (:<:) f g) => f :<: ((:+:) h g)

we can inject f a into larger type (h :+: g) a by composing the first injection with an additional Inr.

(Functor f, Functor g) => f :<: ((:+:) f g)

This explains, how to inject any value of type f a to a value of type (f :+: g) a, regardless of g.

(Functor f, Functor g) => Functor ((:+:) f g)

Instance of combined functors

(Render f, Render g) => Render ((:+:) f g)

Instance for rendering

(Eval f, Eval g) => Eval ((:+:) f g) 
(Exec f, Exec g) => Exec ((:+:) f g)

Exec for both Teletype and FileSystem

(Run f, Run g) => Run ((:+:) f g)

Instance Run for Incrementation and Recall.

class (Functor sub, Functor sup) => sub :<: sup where

With this type class, we won't have to write injections using Inl and Inr

Methods

inj :: sub a -> sup a

injection

Instances

Functor f => f :<: f

reflexivity

(Functor f, Functor g, Functor h, (:<:) f g) => f :<: ((:+:) h g)

we can inject f a into larger type (h :+: g) a by composing the first injection with an additional Inr.

(Functor f, Functor g) => f :<: ((:+:) f g)

This explains, how to inject any value of type f a to a value of type (f :+: g) a, regardless of g.
